interface.description: A Text display is a simpler form of display displaying simple unformatted text arranged in rows and columns. Each row is controlled by a separate parameter. This allows for provisioning of different parts of the display to different clients, if desired.

field.name: Nr Rows
field.description: numeric Number of rows on the display. (1)

field.name: Nr Columns
field.description: Number of columns on the display. (2)

field.name: Row %1%
field.description: Contents currently displayed at Row %1%. Rows are numbered 1, 2, ...

sensorData.comment:
Notes:
1. Even though the interface lists contents in rows, the display itself is not required to display the items exactly as a sequence of rows. It might for instance contain one set of rows offset from the others.
2. The interface allows for different column lengths for different rows. This value should be considered the maximum column length, or main column length, of the display. Actual column lengths for each row is controlled using regular expressions in the corresponding control form.

parameter.name: Row %1%
parameter.description: Changes the contents of Row number %1%. Rows are numbered 1, 2, ... In a control form, the parameter must be validated using a `<regex>` validation rule so that only allowed characters are accepted and the maximum length of the row is not exceeded.
